answers.answer: Normally it's over a week unless you're showing complications. Because the due date us only an estimated guess you could be less then 40 weeks so the extra time baby is in the womb is actually beneficial

If there's no complications in your pregnancy (pre-eclampsia, gestational diabetes, etc) then they usually wait a week after your due date. If by 41 weeks baby is not out yet then they will need to induce before 42 weeks.

I have a friend who had her third baby at 43w4d. She wasn't showing any signs of any complications, her dates were absolutely for sure accurate, baby just wanted extra baking time. Her little girl was born absolutely perfect and in her own time.But most practitioners force an induction by 42 weeks or so.My midwives will do an ultrasound at 41 weeks to make sure all is well and periodic NSTs after that but don't start talking about induction until 42 weeks because most babies come on their own without needing to be forced.
I would ask your doctor what their policy is. My midwife induces after 41 weeks if baby hasn't already arrived, but every practice is different.
Im due on 9th july and have been given 21st to be started off if baby aint here x
My doctor explained that she will only let the lil guy bake an extra week. Once he surpasses the 41 week mark its induction for me.

question: What's the longest after your due date will my doctor induce me ? My due date was yesterday will he do it some time this week?
